Title: Data Analyst - Last Mile
Description:
Data Analyst (mid level) | Last Mile | Ocado Solutions | Hatfield | Hybrid (2 days office)

About Us

“We are on a mission to transform the future of grocery retail through sustained technology innovation.”

Ocado Group is putting the world’s retailers online using the cloud, robotics, AI, and IoT. We develop the innovative software and hardware systems that power Ocado.com, the world’s largest online-only grocery retailer as well as the global ‘Ocado Smart Platform’. With everything from websites to fully autonomous warehouses that we design in-house, our employees need to be specialists in a wide range of technologies to help drive our business. We architect and build groundbreaking, game-changing technology solutions.

What does the team do?

The Solutions Analytics Team provides actionable data and insights across the Ocado Smart Platform (OSP), with a focus on optimising operational efficiency, customer satisfaction, and partner success. In the rapidly evolving domain of last-mile operations, we aim to enhance delivery efficiency, sustainability, and precision, ensuring our Partners achieve peak performance.

This team leads cross-functional analytics projects, collaborating with internal teams and external stakeholders to drive innovation, deliver cost-saving solutions, and improve the customer experience.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst, you will extract and interpret data to identify opportunities for efficiency and growth within our partners’ delivery operations. Your insights will directly influence multi-million-pound decisions, improve customer experiences, and contribute to Ocado’s mission of transforming grocery retail.

In addition to working with vast datasets and advanced tools, you’ll lead impactful projects, mentor junior analysts, and play a critical role in shaping analytics solutions that drive global partner success. You’ll be working on things like;


Insight Generation: Extract, analyse, and interpret data to identify trends and opportunities for OSP Partners, driving growth and efficiency.
Strategic Projects: Lead analytical contributions to cross-functional projects that deliver significant business outcomes.
Collaboration: Partner with technology, operations, and external stakeholders to optimise OSP’s impact.
Visualisation & Communication: Create compelling dashboards and reports, presenting insights in actionable, user-friendly formats.
Continuous Improvement: Close data gaps, enhance platform features, and contribute to analytics best practices.
Sustainability Impact: Support initiatives to optimise operations, reducing waste and carbon emissions.


What We’re Looking For

Essential skills and experience:


Proven Analytical Expertise: 2+ years of experience in data analytics, working with Big Data to deliver actionable insights.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL, Excel/Google Sheets, and visualisation tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Data Studio).
Problem-Solving Mindset: Strong capability to analyse and resolve complex issues.
Communication Skills: Ability to present insights to technical and non-technical audiences
Global Perspective: Experience working in diverse, cross-cultural environments.


Desirable Skills


Proficiency in Python and Google Colab for advanced data processing.
Experience with GIS software to drive location-based insights.
Familiarity with AI-driven analytics and predictive modeling.
Experience with process mining technologies such as Celonis.
Additional language skills (e.g., Spanish, French, Japanese, Korean).
Experience in online grocery, retail, or logistics analytics.
Knowledge of data governance, security, and privacy best practices.


What Do I Get In Return


30 Day ‘work from anywhere’ policy +
Remote working for the month of August
25 days annual leave, rising to 27 days after 5 years service (plus optional holiday purchase)
Pension scheme (various options available including employer contribution matching up to 7%)
Private Medical Insurance
22 weeks paid maternity leave and 6 weeks paid paternity leave (once relevant service requirements complete)
Train Ticket loan (interest-free)
Cycle to Work Scheme
Opportunity to participate in Share save and Buy as You Earn share schemes
15% discount on Ocado.com and free delivery for all employees
Income Protection(can be up to 50% of salary for 3 years) and Life Assurance(3 x annual salary)
Free shuttle-bus to and from Hatfield train station


Show more
HTML:
Data Analyst (mid level) | Last Mile | Ocado Solutions | Hatfield | Hybrid (2 days office)

About Us

“We are on a mission to transform the future of grocery retail through sustained technology innovation.”

Ocado Group is putting the world’s retailers online using the cloud, robotics, AI, and IoT. We develop the innovative software and hardware systems that power Ocado.com, the world’s largest online-only grocery retailer as well as the global ‘Ocado Smart Platform’. With everything from websites to fully autonomous warehouses that we design in-house, our employees need to be specialists in a wide range of technologies to help drive our business. We architect and build groundbreaking, game-changing technology solutions.

What does the team do?

The Solutions Analytics Team provides actionable data and insights across the Ocado Smart Platform (OSP), with a focus on optimising operational efficiency, customer satisfaction, and partner success. In the rapidly evolving domain of last-mile operations, we aim to enhance delivery efficiency, sustainability, and precision, ensuring our Partners achieve peak performance.

This team leads cross-functional analytics projects, collaborating with internal teams and external stakeholders to drive innovation, deliver cost-saving solutions, and improve the customer experience.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst, you will extract and interpret data to identify opportunities for efficiency and growth within our partners’ delivery operations. Your insights will directly influence multi-million-pound decisions, improve customer experiences, and contribute to Ocado’s mission of transforming grocery retail.

In addition to working with vast datasets and advanced tools, you’ll lead impactful projects, mentor junior analysts, and play a critical role in shaping analytics solutions that drive global partner success. You’ll be working on things like;

  • Insight Generation: Extract, analyse, and interpret data to identify trends and opportunities for OSP Partners, driving growth and efficiency.
  • Strategic Projects: Lead analytical contributions to cross-functional projects that deliver significant business outcomes.
  • Collaboration: Partner with technology, operations, and external stakeholders to optimise OSP’s impact.
  • Visualisation & Communication: Create compelling dashboards and reports, presenting insights in actionable, user-friendly formats.
  • Continuous Improvement: Close data gaps, enhance platform features, and contribute to analytics best practices.
  • Sustainability Impact: Support initiatives to optimise operations, reducing waste and carbon emissions.

What We’re Looking For

Essential skills and experience:

  • Proven Analytical Expertise: 2+ years of experience in data analytics, working with Big Data to deliver actionable insights.
  • Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL, Excel/Google Sheets, and visualisation tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Data Studio).
  • Problem-Solving Mindset: Strong capability to analyse and resolve complex issues.
  • Communication Skills: Ability to present insights to technical and non-technical audiences
  • Global Perspective: Experience working in diverse, cross-cultural environments.

Desirable Skills

  • Proficiency in Python and Google Colab for advanced data processing.
  • Experience with GIS software to drive location-based insights.
  • Familiarity with AI-driven analytics and predictive modeling.
  • Experience with process mining technologies such as Celonis.
  • Additional language skills (e.g., Spanish, French, Japanese, Korean).
  • Experience in online grocery, retail, or logistics analytics.
  • Knowledge of data governance, security, and privacy best practices.

What Do I Get In Return

  • 30 Day ‘work from anywhere’ policy +
  • Remote working for the month of August
  • 25 days annual leave, rising to 27 days after 5 years service (plus optional holiday purchase)
  • Pension scheme (various options available including employer contribution matching up to 7%)
  • Private Medical Insurance
  • 22 weeks paid maternity leave and 6 weeks paid paternity leave (once relevant service requirements complete)
  • Train Ticket loan (interest-free)
  • Cycle to Work Scheme
  • Opportunity to participate in Share save and Buy as You Earn share schemes
  • 15% discount on Ocado.com and free delivery for all employees
  • Income Protection(can be up to 50% of salary for 3 years) and Life Assurance(3 x annual salary)
  • Free shuttle-bus to and from Hatfield train station

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Data Migration to Workday HCM / Freelance (Inside IR35)




You’ll be working closely with our colleagues across the ERP Transformation Team alongside our Finance, IT, Data & Tech teams and other broader functions to support our global employee data collection, reporting and updating. We are undergoing a large transformation across our People function and the ERP Transformation team has a vast array of projects with touchpoints across multiple projects. We need a data analyst to help us deliver accurate and timely global employee data reports whenever and however needed.




We are building a holistic, sustainable and scalable People Operating Model enabled by Workday HCM and other technology solutions, alongside new ways of working in our service delivery model, including payroll harmonization.




What you'll do




Reporting into the People Transformation Data Lead, you will:




· Become the company's subject matter expert in all things related to global employee data with curiosity and a willingness to dive into the details to understand the data, it sources and definitions.

· Filter and “clean” data by reviewing validation reports.

· Update data within various source systems, which will require an understanding of our data lineage.

· Identify opportunities to establish and/or improve operational processes to update and maintain our data, improving quality and implementing scalable solutions for our employee data lifecycle.

· Document end to end data entry, update, and reporting processes.

· Assist with communications notifying stakeholders of new/improved processes.

· Responsible for stakeholder issue resolution.

· Assist with future upgrades and system enhancements which may include new software.

· Interpret stakeholder data reporting requirements, analyse data and provide outgoing reports.

· Scope out and support projects related to our data that span functions.

· Implement metrics and timelines with any data project required.

· Manage multiple data-related projects at one time, identifying and raising risks, dependencies, and prioritization concerns.




What you'll need:




· Analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills

· HCM / People Data Experience; Workday HCM a plus

· Workday Enterprise Interface Builder experience

· Experience of Data visualization tools

· Willingness to learn new tools and systems

· Ability to effectively communicate across a global community which requires an openness to diversity of thought, backgrounds and cultures

· Technology experience or interest

· Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills

· Comfortable in dealing with all levels of company leadership

· Team player but also able to determine workload and be self-motivated

· General enthusiasm for growth and a willingness to be hands on




Start date: 4th August

Duration: 12 month contract

Location: London (some days on-site required)

Rate: £550-575 per day ** INSIDE IR35 **

Show more

Title: APP Data Analyst
Description:
INTRODUCTION

At Burberry, we believe creativity opens spaces. Our purpose is to unlock the power of imagination to push boundaries and open new possibilities for our people, our customers and our communities. This is the core belief that has guided Burberry since it was founded in 1856 and is central to how we operate as a company today.

We aim to provide an environment for creative minds from different backgrounds to thrive, bringing a wide range of skills and experiences to everything we do. As a purposeful, values-driven brand, we are committed to being a force for good in the world as well, creating the next generation of sustainable luxury for customers, driving industry change and championing our communities.

JOB PURPOSE

To provide data analytics and gap analysis of key areas of compliance in the business that would leave us exposed from a risk perspective if not highlighted. This reporting is to be provided across multiple departments within the business.

RESPONSIBILITIES

 

Maintain, run and improve automated KPI and trend analysis reporting and flagging relevant issues to key stakeholders.
Continue to build a suite of reports to highlight exceptions and/or breaches in key areas utilising both SAP and IntelliQ.
Supporting regional APP with evidence gathering during investigations.
System Maintenance to include: monitoring daily data loads and clearing of load errors; weekly gap analysis; regular updates of key data streams from HR, product and finance to ensure reporting is accurate and up to date. Troubleshooting as required to fix issues.
Continue to build a Sharepoint site for the APP team to provide training materials and support for using the system. 
Maintenance of the APP (Asset and Profit Protection) Operations database to include keeping store master and HR data up to date.
Supporting the wider regional team with a growing list of daily, weekly and monthly reports including :
Store KPI Reporting, Adjustment Reporting, Incident Reporting, Digital Fraud Reporting, AML Reporting, Retail Operations Exception Reporting.
Support the team with biannual stock loss reporting to include data cleansing, performing analysis on required areas of concerns and creating store level posters.
Provide ad hoc support to Digital Fraud team with chargebacks.
PERSONAL PROFILE

Essential

Previous Experience with IntelliQ or other data mining systems (This is a mandatory requirement for the role)
Advanced Office 365 Suite, in particular Excel
Data minded
Experience in retail fraud prevention 
Retail chargeback processing
Experience with SQL
Experience with Microsoft Access and Power BI
Previous experience with SAP
Experience using Power Platform
MEASURES OF SUCCESS FOOTER

Burberry is an Equal Opportunities Employer and as such, treats all applications equally and recruits purely on the basis of skills and experience.

 

Posting Notes: United Kingdom || Not Applicable || London || CORPORATE AFFAIRS || CORPORATE - ASSET & PROFIT PROTECTION || n/a ||

Show more

Title: Digital Commerce Data Analyst
Description:
Ralph Lauren Corporation (NYSE:RL) is a global leader in the design, marketing and distribution of premium lifestyle products in five categories: apparel, accessories, home, fragrances, and hospitality. For more than 50 years, Ralph Lauren's reputation and distinctive image have been consistently developed across an expanding number of products, brands and international markets. The Company's brand names, which include Ralph Lauren, Ralph Lauren Collection, Ralph Lauren Purple Label, Polo Ralph Lauren, Double RL, Lauren Ralph Lauren, Polo Ralph Lauren Children, Chaps, among others, constitute one of the world's most widely recognized families of consumer brands.

At Ralph Lauren, we unite and inspire the communities within our company as well as those in which we serve by amplifying voices and perspectives to create a culture of belonging, ensuring inclusion, and fairness for all. We foster a culture of inclusion through: Talent, Education & Communication, Employee Groups and Celebration.

Key role in the EMEA E-commerce planning & analytics team ensuring they will deliver insights, reporting, and advanced analytics to drive business decisions and support optimizing the digital customer journey, customer services, and performance marketing. They will solve complex business problems / challenges through data analytics and will story-tell the actionable insights to the key stakeholders to drive and encourage data-driven decision making. They will build key relationships with internal and external stakeholders, RLE associates and other analysts around the business. They will become an SME for one of the Digital Commerce Teams i.e. Performance Marketing, and will own and maintain that dialogue whilst also pro-actively delivering innovative and creative analytics in that space.


Develop a reporting suite that clearly and accurately demonstrate ROI and profitability, from campaigns, collections, customer journeys, digital product, and merchandise product perspective using Adobe, Dataiku, Microstrategy tools, across a range of metrics that cover all stages of the consumer journey, transactions and voice of the customer interactions.
Creation and maintenance of reports and dashboards using web analytics data and data visualisation tools, with the ambition to automate all reporting across the business, whilst monitoring the core KPIs vs. targets.
Proactively seek to solve complex business problems/challenges through data analytics and will translate data into actionable insights and drive data-driven decision making.
Play a key role in the experimentation process and UX improvements through A/B & MVT tests
Monitor competitors’ activities and provide updates on best cases and market trends.
Become the E-commerce team's analytics power user, promoting tool awareness and capability (adobe/microstrategy/Dataiku)
Monitor competitors’ activities and provide updates on best cases and market trends.
Liaise with appointed external agencies who are supporting digital analytics.


Experience, Skills & Knowledge


Adobe Analytics
SQL
Dataiku (nice to have)
Microstrategy (nice to have)
Tableau (nice to have)
Knowledge of the ecommerce analytics landscape
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Location: Hybrid - London

Package: Negotiable + Benefits




The Data Analyst for the Data & Analytics team will be responsible for gathering, collating and analysing data and translating them into data and reporting needs, using technical expertise to ensure data accuracy and high-quality, whilst ensuring delivery deadlines meet business requirements. Working closely with the data & analytics team, developers, business stakeholders and the wider data team in resolving operational and data issues.




The day to day:

You will be an experienced analyst who specialises in delivering Data Projects. Your primary responsibilities will include:

Working with a team of data analysts, engineers, and other specialists, you will own or delegate tasks, ensure effective communication, and foster a collaborative work environment.
Working closely with business stakeholders to understand their data needs to ensure their expectations are met.
Plan and lead meetings with business and technical staff, documenting outputs, proactively seeking subsequent agreement and sign-off.
Share duties with the wider data & analytics team to ensure data is delivered accurately and on time to the business.
Ensuring data is delivered accurately, efficiently, and according to agreed-upon timelines.
Serving as a point of contact for data operations activities. You'll clearly communicate progress, roadblocks, and solutions for activities to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and efficiency gains.




About you:

Degree educated in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics), Business, or related fields
Significant relevant analytics experience
Proficient in SQL, data visualisation tools and Excel
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Advanced knowledge of geospatial tools
Broad knowledge of Catastrophe Risk Models, including output and metrics
Understanding of the insurance marketplace
Pricing experience




The rewards:

A negotiable basic salary and all the normal benefits you’d expect (Holiday, company pension etc.)
A collaborative, open and honest environment that is designed to deliver the best outcomes to our clients and staff.
A flexible working methodology to enable you to be where you need to be. The data & analytics team are typically in the office 3 days a week.
An environment built around supporting and developing our staff with funding available for relevant professional qualifications.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Overview




We are seeking a skilled and proactive Data Analyst to manage and enhance data assets within our presentational layer.




This role is central to the maintenance and development of our data warehouse and the creation of effective data marts and semantic models that support reporting and business intelligence.




Based in either Hoddesdon or Farringdon, this position requires strong technical expertise in data transformation, data modelling, and warehouse development, alongside the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate clearly.




Key Responsibilities:




Design, develop, and maintain scalable and efficient data warehouses, data marts, and semantic models using SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) and Power BI
Work closely with internal teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data models
Validate data models through Power BI reports and support data quality initiatives
Apply a deep understanding of business logic to develop meaningful and reliable data structures
Monitor performance, identify and resolve issues, and ensure ongoing reliability and integrity of data models




About You




Proven experience as a Data Analyst within an Azure environment in a medium or large organisation
Strong knowledge of data transformation, modelling principles, and data warehouse/mart architecture
Hands-on experience with Power BI and semantic model development
Ability to work effectively with stakeholders and understand their data needs
Degree in a relevant field or equivalent professional experience
Azure data certifications are desirable but not essential




What We Offer




We offer a supportive and forward-thinking work environment, along with a competitive benefits package designed to recognise and reward your contribution:




Competitive salary
Generous annual leave, including an extra day off on your birthday
Private medical insurance
Pension scheme and life assurance
Cycle to Work scheme
Discounts on shopping, dining, and more
Ongoing training and skills development opportunities
Enhanced family-friendly policies
24/7 Virtual GP and Employee Assistance Programme
Physical, mental, and financial wellbeing support

Title: Data Analyst, EMEA Supply Chain Operations – 1 Year Fixed Contract
Description:
Job Description

Join our dynamic team at LEGO and play a pivotal role in transforming our EMEA Supply Chain Operations through innovative data solutions and process automation that drive efficiency and visibility!


Core Responsibilities





Develop impactful reporting through effective data sourcing, transformation, and visualization to provide operational insights that drive actionable outcomes.
Implement digital process automation in line with Citizen Development guidelines, to enhance operational efficiency in Supply Chain Operations.
Ensure data quality and compliance across all reporting and optimization initiatives by applying data governance principles.
Follow established standards for robust, documented, and supportable solutions with effective change management.
Collaborate with operational teams to gather user stories, assess business goals, risks, and anticipated value.
Share processes and technical solutions to support the definition of global standards, enhancing value as One LEGO Team.
Promote digital capabilities by educating and empowering teams with digital skills.
Build understanding of Global Supply Chain processes and leverage data solutions to improve operational performance.




Play your part in our team succeeding

By joining EMEA Supply Chain Operations, you will have the opportunity to work with our talented team and play an active part in putting our products into the hands of children across EMEA.

The EMEA Supply Chain Operations Technology function is part of the EMEA Supply Chain Operations organization, and supports and optimizes our operations, providing accurate, engaging and timely information to operational teams to support delivery of our priorities.

Acting as functional experts, the team supports a range of digital solutions, from collaborative creation of user stories to development, delivery and support of data solutions.

To support our digitalization journey, the function also plays an active role in building digital awareness and capability across the EMEA Supply Chain Operations organization.

Do you have what it takes?





Advanced expertise in Microsoft Power BI (incl. DAX), with strong capabilities in complex data transformation beyond visualization.
Advanced expertise in SQL or Python.
Experience across a range of data tools and platforms (such as Databricks, Alteryx, Microsoft Power Platform, for flexible data sourcing, transformation, visualization, and automation).
Proven analytical skills with Agile problem-solving experience, exceptional attention to detail, and a proactive, driven approach.
A strong communicator,that is able to translate technical concepts for non-technical audiences.
Committed to building inclusive, collaborative team environments.
Preferred Supply Chain exposure, Databricks, Alteryx and SAP experience.




Please note that we do not offer relocation assistance for this position.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.


Show more
HTML:
Job Description

Join our dynamic team at LEGO and play a pivotal role in transforming our EMEA Supply Chain Operations through innovative data solutions and process automation that drive efficiency and visibility!


Core Responsibilities



  • Develop impactful reporting through effective data sourcing, transformation, and visualization to provide operational insights that drive actionable outcomes.
  • Implement digital process automation in line with Citizen Development guidelines, to enhance operational efficiency in Supply Chain Operations.
  • Ensure data quality and compliance across all reporting and optimization initiatives by applying data governance principles.
  • Follow established standards for robust, documented, and supportable solutions with effective change management.
  • Collaborate with operational teams to gather user stories, assess business goals, risks, and anticipated value.
  • Share processes and technical solutions to support the definition of global standards, enhancing value as One LEGO Team.
  • Promote digital capabilities by educating and empowering teams with digital skills.
  • Build understanding of Global Supply Chain processes and leverage data solutions to improve operational performance.



Play your part in our team succeeding

By joining EMEA Supply Chain Operations, you will have the opportunity to work with our talented team and play an active part in putting our products into the hands of children across EMEA.

The EMEA Supply Chain Operations Technology function is part of the EMEA Supply Chain Operations organization, and supports and optimizes our operations, providing accurate, engaging and timely information to operational teams to support delivery of our priorities.

Acting as functional experts, the team supports a range of digital solutions, from collaborative creation of user stories to development, delivery and support of data solutions.

To support our digitalization journey, the function also plays an active role in building digital awareness and capability across the EMEA Supply Chain Operations organization.

Do you have what it takes?



  • Advanced expertise in Microsoft Power BI (incl. DAX), with strong capabilities in complex data transformation beyond visualization.
  • Advanced expertise in SQL or Python.
  • Experience across a range of data tools and platforms (such as Databricks, Alteryx, Microsoft Power Platform, for flexible data sourcing, transformation, visualization, and automation).
  • Proven analytical skills with Agile problem-solving experience, exceptional attention to detail, and a proactive, driven approach.
  • A strong communicator,that is able to translate technical concepts for non-technical audiences.
  • Committed to building inclusive, collaborative team environments.
  • Preferred Supply Chain exposure, Databricks, Alteryx and SAP experience.



Please note that we do not offer relocation assistance for this position.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Title: TikTok LIVE Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities
The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. Our focus is to continually champion and optimize TikTok LIVE through working with creators to ensure a creative, fun and safe space for all of our users.

The Regional LIVE Operation Strategy Team leads various cross-functional projects. Our key initiatives include developing strategic plans to drive widespread adoption of LIVE at scale among creators, localizing new product features, creating user engagement strategies, ensuring a positive creator experience through education on the Community Guidelines and best practices, and providing ad hoc analysis and support to cross-functional partners.

Responsibilities:
- Analyzing local and global trends to help improve performance within the EU LIVE team
- Creating and preparing reports and dashboards to help us better identify areas of focus and trends within our ecosystem

Examples of Problems You'll Be Solving:
- What are the best content verticals for us to focus our creator recruitment on?
- Building a prediction model for identifying creators who may be destined for success on our platform
- Which metrics and leading and lagging indicators should we use for our key OKRs?
- How should we best segment our creators and users to have a more meaningful impact on their growth?
- What are the best touch-points to educate our creators, and when should we activate this education?
- Using statistical tools to simplify complex data sets, helping us better diagnose issues and propose solutions

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in data analysis
- Strong mathematical skills to measure, collect, and analyze data
- Attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications:
- Proficiency in statistics and experience using data visualization software such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker
- Knowledge of SQL and any programming languages (Python is highly preferred)

About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.​


Why Join Us
Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect – and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.​
We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.​
​
Diversity & Inclusion​
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.​

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Harris Global is currently seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join a leading client on a permanent basis. This is a highly collaborative role, requiring both technical expertise and strong business acumen.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse large and complex datasets to uncover trends and opportunities across core operational areas.
Design, build and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to support strategic and operational decision making.
Partner with business stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver tailored data solutions.
Ensure accuracy, consistency and quality of data used across analytics and reporting.




Required Qualifications & Skills:

Education & Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics or related field.
3+ years in a Data Analyst or Business Intelligence role.
Experience in financial services or fintech preferred.
Strong SQL and experience with Python, R or similar.
Familiarity with data lakes/warehouses (Snowflake, Databricks).







If you meet the above criteria and are looking for your next challenge, we’d love to hear from you – apply now!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (Social Media Focus)

Location: Southwark, London

Working Model: Hybrid

Salary: Up to £42K




About Goat:

Goat is part of WPP Media (formerly GroupM), the world’s leading media investment company. Since 2015, we've been pioneers in influencer marketing, helping brands leverage the power of social media to achieve real, measurable results. Today, we stand as the global leader in the space, delivering award-winning campaigns across 70+ countries.




As part of our team, you'll collaborate with 500+ social natives worldwide, driving cutting-edge influencer campaigns for some of the most exciting brands. Whether it’s short-term activations or long-term ambassador programs, we treat influencer marketing as a full-funnel channel that drives awareness, engagement, and conversions.




Our data-driven approach is built on insights from tracking over 100,000 influencers and campaign performance. We combine this with expert relationship management, social-first creative strategy, paid media, and advanced tracking, measurement, and optimisation to deliver results that matter.




We’re also proud to be recognised as a recipient of the ‘Top Employer Europe 2024’ certification, underscoring our commitment to fostering a dynamic and supportive work environment. If you’re ready to be part of the team shaping the industry, we’d love to hear from you.




Your responsibilities will include:

Collaborating with Paid and Organic Campaign teams to deliver data-led strategies that optimise performance, improve efficiency, and enhance targeting across live campaigns.
Extracting, cleaning and analysing large-scale social media datasets to uncover patterns, trends and actionable insights that inform campaign planning and decision-making.
Working cross-functionally with campaign managers, strategists and creative teams to embed data-driven thinking throughout campaign execution.
Working with the Campaign Data team to ensure accurate data capture, storage and retrieval, while supporting the evaluation and implementation of tools to improve data workflows.
Communicating complex data findings clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences, including internal stakeholders and clients.
Continuously monitoring campaign performance, using data to assess effectiveness and recommend opportunities for ongoing optimisation.
Producing clear, insightful reports and dashboards highlighting key trends, performance metrics and strategic recommendations.
Supporting audience development and strategic planning from a data-first perspective, using segmentation and behavioural analysis.




Required experience to apply:

Strong understanding of paid and organic social media, with an analytical mindset and a focus on performance.
Proven experience working with large datasets and translating findings into meaningful insights that inform strategy.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical data and analysis in a simple, engaging way.
Minimum of 2 years’ experience in a social media or digital marketing environment, with a focus on analytics and reporting.




Company Culture and Benefits:

Regular social events and ongoing clubs
Provided MacBook laptop to work from
Flexi-hours
Hybrid Working
£200 grant to make your working from home set up comfortable once you’ve passed probation
Health and wellbeing allowance once you’ve passed probation
Health Insurance after you’ve passed probation
Life Insurance Policy
25 Days Holiday plus bank holidays, accruing up to 30 days based on length of service
Birthday & Work Anniversary Days Off
Length of Service Gifts
In-Office Benefits such as beauty treatments & yoga
Flexible Bank Holidays
Volunteering Days
Free Flu Jabs

Plus many more!

Show more

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Ipsos Jarmany was founded in 2008 and is one of the UK’s fastest-growing data consultancy businesses, specialising in data visualisation. Our mission is to build a world-class organisation that helps businesses transform the way they manage and utilise data.

We provide a range of data services, including data strategy, platforms, visualisation and data science, to help our clients uncover the true story their data is telling them and enable them to make data-informed decisions to drive growth and business impact.

Our growing team of data analysts are at the cutting-edge of technology, using advanced analytics tools like Power BI, Google Cloud Platform and Microsoft Azure. We believe in empowering our people so they can become more confident, thrive and fulfil their potential, of course whilst having fun and learning new skills!

And, we’re on the hunt for new and ambitious talent… fancy joining us?

About The Role

As a Graduate Data Analyst, you’ll be working on major projects for globally recognised organisations. You will take on real-world problems for global clients, blending data analytics with strategic acumen from day one, whilst receiving continuous support and training to aid in your development.

At Ipsos Data Labs we place huge emphasis on the collection and structuring of information and utilise a variety of technologies to assist with the ETL process. You’ll be responsible for designing and managing these automated systems and processes while helping to implement best practice throughout the organisation.

You’ll have the opportunity to challenge yourself to fully utilise your capabilities, supporting our commercial teams in developing methods to present and explain complex analysis in a straight-forward, easy to understand way.

As part of this role, you will be enrolled in our graduate scheme which will support you through the first 18 months of your time at Ipsos Data Labs. The scheme will provide you with a structured programme, continuous mentorship, training and hands-on assignments to propel your understanding of data’s impact in the business landscape.

What we look for


A combination of technical capability and commercial acumen
Strong analytical skills combined with excellent communication and presentation skills needed to convey the analysis and insights to clients
Self-motivated individuals who thrive independently and, in a team, setting
Ambitious and driven individuals who want to be future leaders, take on responsibility and hold themselves accountable
Individuals who can apply technical insights derived from data to strategic thinking enabling businesses to achieve their desired objectives


Qualifications & Experience


Minimum 2:1 bachelor’s degree in a STEM subject
Ideally, an A Level in Math or Economics (Grade A / 7 or above preferable)
Programming experience is preferred but not essential


Skills you'll develop


Advanced Excel, Python and SQL Skills
Front-End Data Visualisation Development
Data-driven Commercial Storytelling
Marketing ROI and Digital Analytics Skills
Advanced Presentation Skills


A Typical Day...

Required

The role of our Data Analysts varies depending on the client and project they’ve been assigned to, but typically you’ll be required to:


Engage with extensive data sets using advanced data mining and predictive analytics techniques to uncover and communicate insights.
Design and optimise data processing systems to support data-driven decision-making processes.
Develop compelling data visualisations and dashboards that translate complex analyses into actionable strategies.
Foster collaborative relationships across teams to innovate and enhance commercial solutions.


Diversity and Inclusion

As an equal opportunities' employer, Ipsos Jarmany is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees and does not condone discrimination on the basis of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership. We aspire to have a diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply and join Ipsos Jarmany. We are also “Disability Confident Committed” to ensure we offer a recruitment process and working environment that is accessible to all candidates. Please let us know as soon as possible if you need any additional support so that we can make appropriate adjustments during the recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🚨 Data Analyst – Contract | £450–£550pd | Outside IR35 | Hybrid (3 days onsite – Central London)

6-Month Initial Contract | Banking Sector




We’re looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join a challenger banking client on a 6-month contract basis. This role offers the opportunity to work on meaningful projects that inform high-level business decisions across a complex financial environment.




🔍 Key Details:

Rate: £450–£500 per day
IR35: Outside IR35
Duration: 6 months (potential extension)
Location: Central London (3 days onsite, 2 remote)
Sector: Banking/Financial Services




🎯 Key Responsibilities:

Analyse large and complex datasets (e.g., customer behaviour, sales trends, market data)
Create insightful reports, dashboards, and visualisations using tools like Power BI or Tableau
Design and run efficient SQL queries to extract and manipulate data
Develop and maintain BI tools and solutions to support decision-making
Perform data validation and quality control to ensure integrity and accuracy
Deliver ad hoc analysis and actionable insights to stakeholders




💼 Required Skills & Experience:

3+ years in a Data Analyst role within complex business environments
Strong SQL skills and experience with data visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, or similar)
Experience of Python or R would be a plus.
Comfortable working with large datasets and drawing business-relevant conclusions
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills
Experience in the banking or financial sector is a strong plus

Excellent communication skills

  • Previously worked in Financial Services or similar industry is desirable
  • Excellent communication skills


Salary: Up to £50,000 + bonus + package

Grade: Associate

Location: London (good work from home options available)


If you are interested and meet the above requirements please apply immediately.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Nuclear Energy Innovation




💼 £45,000–£55,000 + benefits | Hybrid – London




We’re working with a pioneering nuclear energy company that’s transforming how low-carbon power is designed, delivered, and scaled across the UK. As they continue to grow, they’re looking for a skilled and curious Data Analyst to help drive smarter decisions across engineering, operations, and strategy.




This isn’t your typical analyst role — it’s a chance to work at the intersection of energy, innovation, and impact. You’ll be turning complex datasets into meaningful insights that shape everything from reactor performance to long-term infrastructure planning.




Why This Role Stands Out

✔ Work on nationally significant clean energy projects

✔ Join a purpose-driven business at the cutting edge of nuclear technology

✔ Strong technical team with a collaborative, learning-focused culture

✔ Hybrid working with flexible hours and career development support




What You’ll Be Doing

Analysing operational and performance data from nuclear systems and infrastructure
Building dashboards, reports, and predictive models to inform business and engineering decisions
Working closely with engineers, scientists, and leadership teams to translate data into action
Supporting continuous improvement and regulatory reporting processes
Contributing to data strategy, governance, and tooling decisions as the team scales




What They’re Looking For

Strong experience in data analysis, ideally within engineering, energy, or regulated sectors
Proficient in SQL, Python (or R), and data visualisation tools like Power BI or Tableau
Comfortable working with complex datasets and extracting clear insights
Great communication skills — able to explain technical findings to non-technical stakeholders
Passionate about using data to contribute to a cleaner energy future




If you’re looking for a meaningful role where your analysis directly supports the UK’s path to net zero — this is it.




📩 Apply now or message me directly to find out more.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

London | Hybrid

£50–60k + benefits




Join a well-backed, growing bank in the middle of a major transformation - modernising its systems, launching new business lines, and putting data at the centre of it all.




This is a chance for a hands-on Data Analyst to make a real impact. You'll work closely with business teams, shape how data is used across the bank, and help build the foundations of a more data-driven culture.




If you're looking to grow your career while doing meaningful work - not just pulling reports - this could be a great fit.




What You’ll Be Doing

Work with stakeholders across the business (Risk, Compliance, Change) to understand and solve real-world data problems
Clean, validate, and reconcile data from multiple systems, including core banking and CRM
Support data migration efforts as the bank upgrades and modernises its platforms
Contribute to shaping data governance and improving data quality across the organisation
Ensure reporting data meets internal governance and compliance standards
Be part of the wider transformation journey, helping the bank scale its data maturity




Essential Skills

Strong SQL skills
Experience working with multiple relational databases (e.g. SQL Server, MySQL, Postgres)
Awareness of data modelling concepts
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Ability to work with non-technical stakeholders and explain complex data clearly
Proactive, organised, and comfortable working in a fast-changing environment




Desirable Skills

Familiarity with BI tools like Power BI or Tableau
Basic Python or scripting for data manipulation
Understanding of ETL pipelines or data flows
Experience with core banking or financial systems
Exposure to cloud-based platforms (e.g. Azure)
Awareness of regulatory frameworks like GDPR or BCBS239




Why This Role Stands Out

Backed by a major European bank – stability + long-term growth
Transformation in motion – new leadership, new systems, and a clear modernisation plan
Big impact, small team – get visibility, influence change, and work closely with senior decision-makers
Supportive environment – strong team culture, mentoring, and variety in the work
Hybrid working – 3 days in the office based in a brand-new central London office




If you’re a data analyst who enjoys making sense of complex data and wants to play a part in shaping the future of a growing bank - we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

London - Hybrid (2 Days Onsite)

Inside IR35 - Daily Rate




Our client is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to support a key client engagement within their professional services division. This is an initial 1 year contract based in London, operating on a hybrid basis (2 days onsite per week) and falling inside IR35.

Independently manage data extraction, cleansing, and transformation activities

Analyze large-scale datasets to generate actionable insights and visualizations
Collaborate across technical and business teams to drive data-driven decision making

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company

CompassRock provides asset and property management services to the rental housing sector. Originally founded in the U.S., the company has expanded to the UK and is rapidly growing its portfolio of Build-to-Rent (BTR) assets across England and Europe. Backed by private equity, CompassRock is in an exciting growth phase, actively acquiring and developing new assets at a fast pace. With an entrepreneurial and innovative culture embedded in its DNA, the company values the dynamic, forward-thinking individuals it employs. As CompassRock continues to expand, there will be abundant opportunities for career advancement and professional development.







About the Role

We are seeking a curious and commercially minded Data Analyst to join our growing team at CompassRock. While this role is based in the residential rental sector, we actively welcome applications from professionals with experience in hospitality, airlines, or broader real estate industries—particularly those who bring a passion for elevating customer experience through data-driven decisions. Our mission is to redefine urban renting—delivering a seamless, service-led living experience. Your analysis will directly inform pricing strategies, marketing performance, resident satisfaction, leasing effectiveness, and broader commercial planning across our portfolio.







Responsibilities

Leverage large datasets to generate actionable insights around resident behaviour, leasing trends, retention, and demand drivers.
Support the leasing and revenue teams by identifying opportunities for rent optimization, concession planning, and lead conversion improvement.
Monitor and analyse digital marketing channel performance (e.g. PPC, aggregators, OTAs), particularly for lease-ups and new openings.
Benchmark operational and service KPIs—occupancy, turnaround times, customer service touchpoints—across sites or regions.
Translate data into clear visual dashboards and compelling presentations for senior stakeholders.
Collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, leasing, revenue management and operations to improve the end-to-end resident experience.




Qualifications

Proven analytical experience in BTR, hospitality, airlines, hotels, or real estate.
Experience in building and structuring datasets or data cubes to support scalable reporting and analytics—ideally with a view to implementing BI tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Proficient in working with large datasets using tools like SQL and Excel.
A commercial mindset with the ability to link data insights to real business outcomes.
Strong communication skills—you know how to turn complex numbers into actionable recommendations.
Curious, collaborative, and highly adaptable.




Preferred Skills

Experience in revenue management, pricing analytics, or marketing attribution.
Exposure to customer or guest satisfaction data (e.g. NPS, reviews, feedback tools).
Previous work with leasing systems or property management software.




Pay range and compensation package

Salary: Competitive
Bonuses: Discretionary Bonus Scheme
Benefits:
a) Company Pension Scheme;
b) Vitality Private Healthcare Insurance;
c) Company Sick Pay;
d) Bike to Work Scheme
Working Hours: 40 hour working week
Job Type: Full-time, Permanent, 4x work from the office, 1x WFH
Location: Marylebone, London (Corporate Head Office)




Equal Opportunity Statement

We are an Equal Opportunities Employer, committed to creating an inclusive, diverse, and equitable workplace. We provide equal opportunities for everyone and offer reasonable adjustments to ensure all candidates have a fair chance during the recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
IDP Education Limited

About IDP

IDP is the global leader in international education services, delivering global success to students, test takers, and our partners through trusted human relationships, digital technology, and customer research. An Australian-listed company, we operate in more than 50 countries around the world.

Our team is comprised of over 7,000 people of various nationalities, ages, and cultural backgrounds. Proudly customer-first, our expert people are powered by global technology. Together, we offer unmatched services, helping local dreams become realities all over the world.

Learn more at www.careers.idp.com﻿

Role purpose

IDP is developing the world’s largest international student community. With this community comes access to the world’s largest student data set, the ability to better understand our customers' behavior, and the ability to identify opportunities for our clients and the business.

As a data analyst, you will use data intelligence to produce insights into customer behavior, help guide client strategy and planning decisions, and support the company’s thought leadership positioning in the industry.

The role is highly collaborative, supporting key functions of the IDP Partnerships team in their mission to enhance client capabilities with the transformative power of data, insights, and engaged student communities.

Working with internal stakeholders to inform evidence-based decision-making in projects aimed at growing our influence in the international education community and supporting the direction of new products, services, and operating models.

Key Accountabilities


Analyze client behavior and market trends through data mining, providing actionable insights to support strategic planning.
Develop reports, presentations, and dashboards for internal and external stakeholders, enhancing data accessibility and usability.
Monitor and improve data quality, ensuring its effectiveness for decision-making.
Educate and train internal teams and clients on leveraging data and analytics, fostering a data-driven culture.

Required Experience


Strong analytical mindset with a natural curiosity to uncover opportunities, identify issues, and recommend solutions.
Experience working with large datasets, including data visualization, manipulation, wrangling, and analysis.
Proven ability to translate analytical findings into actionable insights that drive business decisions.
Strong business acumen, providing both context (‘so what’) and insights (‘what’).
Excellent numerical, written, verbal, and presentation skills, with high attention to detail.
Agile and flexible approach, able to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Highly collaborative and proactive in engaging with stakeholders to achieve results.
Curious and eager to explore new tools, techniques, and methodologies.
Current experience as a data analyst.
Hands-on experience with Tableau or similar data visualization tools.
Proficiency in SQL.
Advanced Excel skills.
Degree in Mathematics and/or Statistics or related field
Education sector experience

IDP is developing the world’s largest international student community. With this community comes access to the world’s largest student data set, the ability to better understand our customers' behavior, and the ability to identify opportunities for our clients and the business.

As a data analyst, you will use data intelligence to produce insights into customer behavior, help guide client strategy and planning decisions, and support the company’s thought leadership positioning in the industry.

The role is highly collaborative, supporting key functions of the IDP Partnerships team in their mission to enhance client capabilities with the transformative power of data, insights, and engaged student communities.

Working with internal stakeholders to inform evidence-based decision-making in projects aimed at growing our influence in the international education community and supporting the direction of new products, services, and operating models.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
We are expanding our team with our increased data services offering. We are looking for a junior member of the team to work with our wider data services and IT team in helping to deliver our pipeline of projects, as well as maintaining and improving our current systems and services. This role is based in our HQ in London but is part of an international company with offices in 9 countries.





Requirements



Key responsibilities:





- Be responsible for the day-to-day monitoring and validation of data services in our London office for European trading hours.


- Assist and support other colleagues in day-to-day data collection and validation activities and deliverables.


- Update manager of progress on daily basis and complete handover to London time zone.


- Assist with data management and data quality, including compiling data for presentations, resolving any data quality issues.


- Help prepare any data related elements for clients requests.


- Work with the Research team in compiling and presenting data to key clients and internal stakeholders in our London office.


- Work with the wider IT team to manage and maintain document libraries, avoiding duplication and data sprawl.


- Responsible for maintaining your End of Day report.


- Ensure full awareness of and adhere to internal policies that relate to the role or any relevant other activities.


- Support a risk and compliance aware culture and comply with FIS company policies.


- Exercise judgement and act with integrity, due care, skill and diligence and be open and co-operative with the FCA, other regulators and exchanges.


- Ensure full awareness of and adhere to internal policies that relate to the role or any relevant other activities.


- Observe standards of market conduct and ensure understanding and adherence to all regulatory, exchange or clearing house requirements applicable to role.


- Complete any mandatory training required by the company and required deadlines.


- Perform any other reasonable duties the company may require.



Training:





- Maintain own Continued Professional Development (CPD).




What we are looking for





- Proactive and self-motivated.


- C#, Python and SQL skills highly desirable.


- Learn quickly and question/challenge any comprehension uncertainties.


- Has a tenacious outlook and focus, able to stick at and resolve tasks.


- Enjoys and has a logical approach to solving problems.


- Has solid statistics and analytics skills.


- Communicates effectively with colleagues.


- First-class work ethic and excellent engagement and professionalism when working with clients.


- Works independently and diligently.


- Is team oriented; working well with others and diverse groups / personalities.


- Prioritises workload and works well under pressure.


- Excellent attention to detail; strong analytical and numeracy skills.


- Good written and verbal communication skills.


- Personable, demonstrating good relationship building skills with both internal and external stakeholders.


- Use of and experience with Excel, Word and Outlook required.


- General IT skills.






Benefits



Our rapidly growing business offers a dynamic environment for talented, entrepreneurial professionals to achieve results and grow their careers.


- Competitive salary and discretionary bonus
- Learning & Development / CPD opportunities
- Pension scheme
- Gym membership
- Employee Assistance Programme
- Private healthcare and life assurance scheme
- 25 days holiday
- Season ticket travel loan
- Cycle to work scheme
- Electric Vehicle Scheme

Title: Data Specialist
Description:
Job Description

Are you interested in being a key contributor in enabling our LEGO® Retail organisation to understand its shoppers deeply and expand data transparency to drive data driven decisions that always put the shopper first? Now it's your chance!

Please note the work location is in our London Hub and no relocation assistance is offered for this role.

As we are in the holiday season, please note that there may be delays in the recruitment process. We thank you for your patience and understanding during this period.


Core Responsibilities

Bring your understanding of data platforms together with your retail/e-commerce knowledge and natural curiosity into play in this role to be part of a pioneering data and analytics team bringing digital transformation to life in our commercial areas! You will





Partner with Shopper digital product teams to ensure high quality data is collected and published to LEGO Nexus (DataBricks) to a standard fit for purpose for downstream delivery of data products.
Transform, cleanse and enrich data to build self-serve data sources for use across analytical teams, the broader A&I organisation, LEGO® Retail teams & other data consumers (ie personalization, digital consumer engagement).
Develop self-serve dashboards and establish the use of these tools with LEGO Retail and broader Commercial colleagues to drive data driven decision making.
Collaborate with colleagues across LEGO® Retail, Data Science and A&I Commercial Analytics to continually iterate and enrich data products & overall data availability.
Enable LEGO® Retail specific data understanding and champion data literacy via guidelines, training, drop-in sessions, documentation, and knowledge sharing.
Partner with the Data Office to ensure platforms, tools & processes meet business needs, acting as inputters, collaborators, testers and/or ambassadors.
Consistently champion best practices in data product development within the team, across LEGO® Retail and with the broader analytics community, helping ensure data integrity, -quality, and -scalability of overall LEGO® Retail data products on the LEGO Data Platform.




Play your part in our team succeeding

The department’s key focus is to enable self-service data products for LEGO® Retail data consumers and decision makers, helping shape data-driven actions both for operational optimisation purposes and tactical and strategical decision recommendations. The key collaborators of this role will initially be heavily focused in Marketing & e-Commerce but have potential to expand to be multifunctional in areas such as Stores, Finance, Operations etc.

This role is essential as we further invest in our digitalization agenda, and our new data strategy, including scaling the LEGO® Data Platform to unlock the value from data across the LEGO® Group. In order to become truly data-driven, our first party retail and direct to consumer activity is the cornerstone to everything we do. This role will help both enrich our current data landscape and bring new data variables to life, but also enable important data development projects around the business to use LEGO® Retail data that will both increase accuracy in the models and speed up insights to action.

Do you have what it takes?

We’re looking for candidates with a solid foundation in a relevant field such as Mathematics, Sciences, Business Intelligence, or Analytics — either through formal education or hands-on experience with proven results using relevant tools.

You bring experience as a Data Specialist, in Data Solutions, Analytics Engineering, or Data Engineering. You’re confident working with large structured and unstructured datasets and have solid skills in SQL, Python, or similar languages. You’re also comfortable building visualizations in Power BI or equivalent tools to support business decision-making.

Ideally, you have worked in the Retail industry and are able to bridge technical and non-technical worlds — explaining constraints and trade-offs to colleagues at all levels, including leadership.

You are thorough, detail-oriented, and passionate about delivering results, even in changing or complex environments. You take ownership, work independently, and thrive in collaboration, bringing a #OneTeam mindset. A positive, can-do attitude, natural curiosity, and the courage to challenge constructively are key to your approach.

You’re fluent in English (spoken and written), and open to occasional travel (up to 10 days per year) for team meetings or workshops.

Nice to have





Cross-culture understanding of working with global colleagues and partners across multiple time zone
Experience working with ETL processes and knowledge of data transformation best practices.
Familiarity with agile ways of working.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.


Show more
HTML:
Job Description

Are you interested in being a key contributor in enabling our LEGO® Retail organisation to understand its shoppers deeply and expand data transparency to drive data driven decisions that always put the shopper first? Now it's your chance!

Please note the work location is in our London Hub and no relocation assistance is offered for this role.

As we are in the holiday season, please note that there may be delays in the recruitment process. We thank you for your patience and understanding during this period.


Core Responsibilities

Bring your understanding of data platforms together with your retail/e-commerce knowledge and natural curiosity into play in this role to be part of a pioneering data and analytics team bringing digital transformation to life in our commercial areas! You will



  • Partner with Shopper digital product teams to ensure high quality data is collected and published to LEGO Nexus (DataBricks) to a standard fit for purpose for downstream delivery of data products.
  • Transform, cleanse and enrich data to build self-serve data sources for use across analytical teams, the broader A&I organisation, LEGO® Retail teams & other data consumers (ie personalization, digital consumer engagement).
  • Develop self-serve dashboards and establish the use of these tools with LEGO Retail and broader Commercial colleagues to drive data driven decision making.
  • Collaborate with colleagues across LEGO® Retail, Data Science and A&I Commercial Analytics to continually iterate and enrich data products & overall data availability.
  • Enable LEGO® Retail specific data understanding and champion data literacy via guidelines, training, drop-in sessions, documentation, and knowledge sharing.
  • Partner with the Data Office to ensure platforms, tools & processes meet business needs, acting as inputters, collaborators, testers and/or ambassadors.
  • Consistently champion best practices in data product development within the team, across LEGO® Retail and with the broader analytics community, helping ensure data integrity, -quality, and -scalability of overall LEGO® Retail data products on the LEGO Data Platform.



Play your part in our team succeeding

The department’s key focus is to enable self-service data products for LEGO® Retail data consumers and decision makers, helping shape data-driven actions both for operational optimisation purposes and tactical and strategical decision recommendations. The key collaborators of this role will initially be heavily focused in Marketing & e-Commerce but have potential to expand to be multifunctional in areas such as Stores, Finance, Operations etc.

This role is essential as we further invest in our digitalization agenda, and our new data strategy, including scaling the LEGO® Data Platform to unlock the value from data across the LEGO® Group. In order to become truly data-driven, our first party retail and direct to consumer activity is the cornerstone to everything we do. This role will help both enrich our current data landscape and bring new data variables to life, but also enable important data development projects around the business to use LEGO® Retail data that will both increase accuracy in the models and speed up insights to action.

Do you have what it takes?

We’re looking for candidates with a solid foundation in a relevant field such as Mathematics, Sciences, Business Intelligence, or Analytics — either through formal education or hands-on experience with proven results using relevant tools.

You bring experience as a Data Specialist, in Data Solutions, Analytics Engineering, or Data Engineering. You’re confident working with large structured and unstructured datasets and have solid skills in SQL, Python, or similar languages. You’re also comfortable building visualizations in Power BI or equivalent tools to support business decision-making.

Ideally, you have worked in the Retail industry and are able to bridge technical and non-technical worlds — explaining constraints and trade-offs to colleagues at all levels, including leadership.

You are thorough, detail-oriented, and passionate about delivering results, even in changing or complex environments. You take ownership, work independently, and thrive in collaboration, bringing a #OneTeam mindset. A positive, can-do attitude, natural curiosity, and the courage to challenge constructively are key to your approach.

You’re fluent in English (spoken and written), and open to occasional travel (up to 10 days per year) for team meetings or workshops.

Nice to have



  • Cross-culture understanding of working with global colleagues and partners across multiple time zone
  • Experience working with ETL processes and knowledge of data transformation best practices.
  • Familiarity with agile ways of working.



Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.
